comments:
When I generate a report the DC runtime component throws the following exceptions:


Caused by: org.eclipse.cosmos.dc.runtime.RetryException: COSMOS Runtime Host not
 initialized
        at org.eclipse.cosmos.dc.birt.helper.LocalHelper.verifyRuntimeHost(Local
Helper.java:49)
        at org.eclipse.cosmos.dc.birt.helper.LocalHelper.getLatestDatasetForSour
ceKeyset(LocalHelper.java:80)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.
java:64)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAcces
sorImpl.java:43)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:615)
        at org.mozilla.javascript.MemberBox.invoke(MemberBox.java:174)
        ... 112 more


Steps to reproduce the problem
===============================
1. To reproduce the problem download the latest driver.  I used: http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/download.php?file=/technology/cosmos/1.0.0/COSMOS-1.0.0-200711051600/cosmos-dr-incubation-COSMOS-1.0.0-200711051600.zip

2. Unzip the driver in the tomcat/webapps directory.

3. Start tomcat.  Note that you have to change the catalina.properties file to point to the derby database.   The catalina.properties file should contain the following entry.
  derby.system.home=C://apache-tomcat-5.5.20/webapps/database


4. Open a browser and point to  http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/org.eclipse.cosmos/tests/data-reporting/org.eclipse.cosmos.dr.tests/WebContent/org/eclipse/cosmos/dr/gvs/report/viewer/LogReport.html?root=Technology_Project&view=co

5. Click the submit button.  This should open another window with the generated report.  If you look at the tomcat console it will show the COSMOS exception

This problem is related to the BIRT driver.

Refer to Bug #209708
